intro: Ottonia loefgrenii, commonly known as the Loefgren's ottonia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. Ottonia loefgrenii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
